document.docAuthor: Cordeiro, Danilo Pacheco, Aquino, Karina Kethelen Silva De & Alves, Veracilda Ribeiro
document.docTitle: Alepia Cordeiro, Aquino & Alves, 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The Psychodidae (Diptera) of Jaú National Park (Amazonas, Brazil) with description of two new species of Psychodinae

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Psychodidae (Diptera) of Jaú National Park (Amazonas, Brazil) with description of two new species of Psychodinae

heading.emphasis:
Alepia iy
Cordeiro & Aquino sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. This species can be identified by the combination of the following characters: eye bridge short and strongly tapering to the midline, eyes separated by a distance equivalent to 8 times the diameter of one facet; gonostylus enlarged distally with spiniforme and hammer-like processes; aedeagus slightly asymmetric in dorsal view, with articulated apical portion, epandrial appendage with one apical digitiform tenaculum and large basal area bearing 28–36 long clavate accessory tenacula.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1–9.
Alepia iy
sp. nov. 1. Head with complete palpus. 2. Head, anterior view. 3. Head, posterior view. 4. Flagellomeres I–XIV. 5. Flagellomeres XI–XIV in detail. 6. Wing. Fig. 7–9. Male terminalia. 7. Lateral view. 8. Detail of hypandrium, gonocoxite, gonostylus and aedeagus, lateral view. 9. Detail of hypandrium, gonocoxite, gonostylus, aedeagal sheath and aedeagus, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Type material.
HOLOTYPE ( INPA ): ♂ , BRAZIL , Amazonas , Parque Nacional do Jaú , Nazaré , Seringalzinho , right margin rio Jaú , PNJ023,
37masl
, 01°54’54”S 61°35’25”W ,
03-06.vii.2003
, Malaise trap ( SW ), col. D. M.Takiya ..
PARATYPES : 32 ♂ same place, data and collectors as holotype (16 at INPA , 14 at MZFS , 2 at LACM )
.
Etymology. The species epithet ‘iy’ derives from the word ‘îy’ from tupi language, meaning hatchet, in reference to the shape of the gonostylus. The name is in apposition.

Comments. This species is morphologically close to
Alepia ancylis Quate & Brown
by venation and infuscation pattern of wing (see Cordeiro 2020 ) and morphology of male terminalia. However, they differ by features on the eye and epandrial appendage. In
A . ancylis
the eye bridge is not strongly tapering to midline, distance of eyes on eye bridge is of only 5 facet diameters and the epandrial appendage is more elongate and with basal area bearing accessory tenacula restricted to basal half of appendage, while in A . iy the eye bridge strongly tapers to midline, eyes are separated by a distance of 8 facet diameters and the epandrial appendage is broader and with basal area bearing accessory tenacula surpassing basal half of appendage.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 1. Species of Psychodidae ( Diptera ) collected at Jaú National Park

Alepia iy
Cordeiro & Aquino sp. nov.
